sentences.english: He cried, his blue eyes blazing angrily behind his spectacles.
sentences.chinese: 他咆哮着，眼镜后的蓝眼睛闪烁着熊熊怒火。

sentences.english: Let your heart burn with loving-kindness for all who may cross your path.
sentences.chinese: 让你的心对所有与你交往的人都燃烧这熊熊爱火。

sentences.english: My hatred burns through the cavernous deeps.
sentences.chinese: 人的仇恨正在淡渊的尽尾熊熊燃焚。

sentences.english: He was watching the red flames in the wide open fireplace .
sentences.chinese: 他注视着敞着的宽大壁炉里的熊熊火焰。

sentences.english: For a moment a flaming ring was raised high up on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 刹那间，一个熊熊燃烧的火圈被高高地支了起来。

sentences.english: The fire flamed out as soon as oil was poured on it.
sentences.chinese: 油一倒在火上，立刻就腾起了熊熊烈焰。

sentences.english: Better a little fire to warm us, than a at one to burn us.
sentences.chinese: 适量的火好取暖，熊熊烈火能焚身。

sentences.english: In what distant deeps or skies Burnt the fire of 3)thine eyes?
sentences.chinese: 你眼中的烈火熊熊来自多远的深处或高空？

sentences.english: The cabinet burst into flames, and eventually the entire house burned down.
sentences.chinese: 橱柜熊熊燃烧起来，到最后，整幢楼都被烧掉了。

sentences.english: On halloween , people burn the fire to drive the evils away.
sentences.chinese: 万圣节时人么点燃熊熊大火来驱逐妖魔鬼怪。

sentences.english: A child had knocked over an oil heater , which burst instantly into flames.
sentences.chinese: 一个小孩打翻了煤油炉，火一下子熊熊燃烧起来了。

sentences.english: The raging flames lit up the whole district.
sentences.chinese: 熊熊的火光照亮了整个的居民区。

sentences.english: The whole village glowed with the light of the great fire.
sentences.chinese: 熊熊大火映红了整个村庄。

sentences.english: Black or gray and black peat can be used as fuel burning.
sentences.chinese: 黑色或灰黑色泥炭可以作为燃料而熊熊燃烧。

sentences.english: Flames are licking at their walls.
sentences.chinese: 熊熊的火焰舔舐着墙脚。

definition: to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
(dialect) intensity of the fire (in cooking, kiln firing etc)
